metadata.synopsis: A widowed U.S. professor (George Segal) and a British divorcee (Glenda Jackson) spoil their French affair by marrying.

reviews: Melvin Frank has a fine track record as a comedy write, but he hasn't the directorial ability to bring off this uneasy blend of slapstick and satire.
Segal-Jackson comedy doesn't wear well with age, but has moments.
This movie is terrible. It's awful.
